article:
For biological Fe-S clusters, see iron-sulfur proteins.

'Iron-sulfur clusters' are ensembles of iron and sulfide centres. Fe-S clusters
are most often discussed in the context of the biological role for iron-sulfur
proteins. S. J. Lippard, J. M. Berg âPrinciples of Bioinorganic Chemistryâ
University Science Books: Mill Valley, CA; 1994. ISBN 0-935702-73-3. Many
Fe-S clusters are known in the area of organometallic chemistry and as
precursors to synthetic analogues of the biological clusters (see Figure).
